original_title: Sri Lanka approves TIQRI Software for Port City incentives
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers has approved TIQRI Software (Pte) Ltd to qualify for incentives as a ‘secondary business of strategic importance,’ Minister Bandula Gunawardena said.
TIQRI Software will invest 100,000 US dollars to set up shop in Colombo Port City.

The project qualifies for exemptions or incentives under 2(b) of Colombo Port City (Guidelines on the Grant of Exemptions or Incentives to Businesses of Strategic Importance) Regulations, No. 2 of 2023, Gunawardena said.
TIQRI is a company set up with Norwegian investment support, which has offices in Sri Lanka, Singapore and Australia, according to the company website.
This week the cabinet also approved Asiri Hospital’s Port City operations, which will invest 100 million dollars, as a business of ‘primary strategic importance.’
The Colombo Port City has been set up as a dollarized, special economic zone. (Colombo/Jan03/2023)
